section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: construction site (建造工地) means a place where construction work is carried out and any area in the immediate vicinity of any such place which is used for the storage of materials or plant used or intended to be used for the purpose of the construction work;
construction waste (建造廢物) means any waste emanating from or located at a construction site;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the alteration, construction, demolition, maintenance, reconstruction, repair or shoring of the whole or any part of any airport, arch, bridge, building, channel, chimney, dock, drain, embankment, hoarding, lighting, pier, public utility, railway, road, service lane, shelter, slope, street, tramway, tunnel, wall, water conduit, wharf or other structure;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: dredging;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the extraction from the earth of any matter whatsoever;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: piling;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: quarrying;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the reclamation of any foreshore and sea-bed;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: any work involved in preparing for any operation of the type referred to in paragraph (a), (b), (c), (d), (e) or (f); and

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the use of machinery, plant, tools, gear and materials in connection with or for any operation referred to in paragraph (a), (b), (c), (d), (e), (f) or (g);

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: means combustion of materials of any type outdoors without any enclosure, where the products of combustion are not directed through a chimney;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: does not mean combustion attendant on the normal and ordinary use of a soldering iron, blowtorch or similar appliance for the purpose for which they are intended to be used;

section.def: permit (許可證) means a permit issued by the Authority under section 6.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Application
section.leadIn: This Regulation applies to all open burning except the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: burning of candle-sticks, joss paper, incense, sacrificial articles and ritual offerings to the deceased, spirits or gods in customary or religious rites, festivals and on festive occasions;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: fires used solely for cooking of food for human consumption, or fires used solely for recreational purposes using wood or charcoal or a small amount of firestarter;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: fires set for the purpose of fire testing, training and education by any Government fire fighting force or agency;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: agricultural burning of materials grown on the site, solely for the purpose of weeding, land disinfection, pest control, or burning to make firebreaks in the countryside; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any open burning which in the opinion of the Director of Environmental Protection is required in an emergency for the purpose of ensuring public safety.

subsection.leadIn: Open burning for the following purposes is prohibited—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the disposal of construction waste;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the clearance of a site in preparation for construction work;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the disposal of tyres; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the salvage of metal.

subsection.leadIn: Any person who carries out open burning which is prohibited by virtue of subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on first conviction to a fine at level 5 and a further fine of $500 for every 15 minutes during which the offence has continued; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on subsequent conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 3 months and a further fine of $500 for every 15 minutes during which the offence has continued.

subsection.content: Open burning to which this Regulation applies by virtue of section 3 shall not be carried out except in accordance with a permit issued under section 6.
The Authority shall not issue a permit for open burning which is prohibited by virtue of section 4.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Application for and issue of permit

subsection.content: The Authority may issue a permit to an applicant on application and payment of the fee of $2,250. (L.N. 578 of 1997; L.N. 305 of 2000; L.N. 180 of 2005)

subsection.leadIn: An application for a permit shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be made in such form as may be specified by the Authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be made not less than 28 days prior to the carrying out of the intended open burning; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be accompanied by such particulars as the Authority may require.

subsection.leadIn: The fee specified in subsection (1) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be paid by the applicant in respect of each application at the time when the application is made; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not be refundable.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in such form as specified by the Authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be valid for 1 year or such lesser period as may be specified by the Authority; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be subject to such conditions as may be imposed by the Authority including conditions as to the dates, the permitted hours, location and number of times of the open burning, and the weight and nature of materials to be burnt, having regard to the abatement of air pollution which is existing or imminent, the practicability and environmental impact of alternative means of waste disposal and the attainment of any relevant air quality objective.

subsection.content: The Authority may on application made in that behalf issue a new permit to replace a permit previously issued by the Authority.

The Authority may refuse to issue a permit or may revoke a permit and in any such case the Authority shall inform the applicant in writing of that refusal or of that revocation, as the case may be, and the reasons therefor.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Open burning without permit or in contravention of permit conditions

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: without a permit, carries out open burning for which a permit may be issued under section 6; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: being a permit holder contravenes any condition to which the permit is subject,

subsection.leadIn: Any person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on first conviction to a fine at level 5 and a further fine of $500 for every 15 minutes during which the offence has continued; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on subsequent conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 3 months and a further fine of $500 for every 15 minutes during which the offence has continued.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), section 7 shall come into operation on the expiry of 28 days after the commencement* of this Regulation.

subsection.leadIn: Where before the expiry of 28 days after the commencement of this Regulation an application is made to the Authority for the issue of a permit under section 6, then in relation to the applicant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the Authority issues a permit, section 7(1)(b) shall come into operation on the expiry of the day when the permit is issued;
